journal-meta.journal-title: Proceedings of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Part J: Journal of Engineering Tribology

title-group.article-title: Numerical evaluation of the transient response due to non-smooth rolling contact using an arbitrary Lagrangian–Eulerian formulation

article-meta.aff: Department of Applied Mechanics, Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg, Sweden

author-notes.corresp: *Corresponding author: Department of Applied Mechanics, Chalmers University of Technology, SE-412 96 Gothenburg, Sweden. email: andreas.draganis@chalmers.se

abstract.p: A theoretical and numerical framework to evaluate rolling contact using an arbitrary Lagrangian–Eulerian (ALE) formulation is established. A finite element formulation is implemented featuring cylinder–plate contact, automated mesh refinement, non-reflecting boundary conditions, and the ability to incorporate surface roughness through user-defined gap functions. Presented examples include rolling contact on a corrugated surface and negotiation of a surface discontinuity. Sensitivity and validation analyses are presented and show the model to be robust and the trends in parametric responses to be reasonable as compared to results in literature. Owing to the ALE formulation, the model can be kept very compact and the computational demands very modest.

sec.title: FUNDING
sec.p: The project is financed by the Swedish Research Council (www.vr.se) under contract 2008-3860 and is a part of the ongoing activities in the National Centre of Excellence CHARMEC (www.chalmers.se/charmec).

ack.title: ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
ack.p: The authors thank Peter Torstensson for providing rail roughness data.
